message: Hi Bob, I have a great product that I think you'll love. I'm willing to offer it to you for $180.
Hello Alice, I appreciate your offer, but I believe I can find a better deal elsewhere. I am willing to pay no more than $120 for the product.
I understand that you're looking for a good deal, Bob. However, I have to make a profit on this sale. I'm willing to meet you halfway, but I need to get at least $160 for the product.
Thank you for your response, Alice. I appreciate your effort to meet my budget constraints. I would like to counter with an offer of $140 for the product.
I'm not willing to go as low as $140, Bob. I'm willing to compromise, but I need to get at least $155 for the product. I'm willing to meet you halfway on the last offer, but I need a bit more.
I understand your position, Alice. I would like to propose an offer of $150 for the product.
I'm getting closer to your price, Bob, but I still need to make a profit. I'm willing to meet you at $155, but I'm not willing to go any lower. This is my final offer.
Considering your last offer, I would like to propose an offer of $152 for the product.
I'm not going to budge any further, Bob. I'm willing to meet you at $152, but I need to get a bit more for the product. I'm willing to meet you at $153, and that's my final offer.
I appreciate your efforts, Alice. Considering our previous discussions, I would like to propose an offer of $151 for the product.
